impetuous: Passionately impulsive, marked by sudden, hasty emotion; forceful, violent
indefatigable: Untiring, not able to become fatigued
impugn: Attack the truth or integrity of
inconstancy: Fickleness, unreliability; the state of changing without good reason
impute: Credit, attribute; lay blame or responsibility for (sometimes falsely)
imprecation: Curse; prayer for harm to come to someone
implacable: Not able to be appeased, calmed, or satisfied
inculcate: Teach persistently, implant (an idea) in a person
